newsitem.title: USA: Citation Computer sees Q3 operating loss.
newsitem.headline: Citation Computer sees Q3 operating loss.

text.p: Citation Computer Systems Inc said Tuesday it expects to report a loss for the third quarter ended December 31 in the range of $0.30 to $0.32 a share, excluding a loss of $0.09 a share for costs from a secondary stock offering that was withdrawn.
Citation also said it expects to report revenues for the quarter of about $4.0 million, down about 38 percent from the year-ago fiscal third quarter.
In the year-ago third quarter, Citation earned $0.22 a share on revenues of $6.5 million.
Citation said the decline in third quarter results was due to reduced system sales, domestically and internationally, compared with record sales in both areas in the prior year.
Earnings were also hurt by lower margins and higher development expenses, which resulted from the increased cost of developing new products and a lower capitalization rate.
J. Robert Cooper, Citation chairman, said lower revenues reflect both a general slowdown in the marketplace and a startup period for sales programs.

"I remain optimistic about Citation's prospects for the future," Cooper added. "It will take another quarter or so for the impact of Citation's new products and programs to be reflected in our operating performance."
He added he believes, in the long term, the company continues to be well positioned to take advantage of emerging trends in the healthcare information systems industry.

Citation added it expects several products, including its CURES community registration system, C-RIS radiology system, and its enhanced C-COM clinical communications system, to begin shipping early in fiscal 1998.
